abstracts.cdata!:
The Decentralized Health System
            Development Project for Sudan had an overall moderately
            satisfactory outcome, with the performances of the Bank and
            the borrower being deemed moderately satisfactory as well.
            All three project development objective indicators were
            fully achieved, while of the eight intermediate outcome
            indicators, seven were fully achieved and one was partially
            achieved. Significant lessons learned during the project
            implementation include: 1) projects overloaded with
            activities create implementation problems; 2) project
            restructuring should be done as early as possible; 3)
            flexibility in design is a major advantage; 4) complexity
            creates problems; 5) future sustainability of primary health
            services will depend on the actions of federal and state
            public health institutions responsible; and 6) strategic
            studies can provide information for future planning.
